name: isosorbide
source: Bergstrom C. A. S.; Norinder U.; Luthman K.; Artursson P. Molecular Descriptors Influencing Melting Point and Their Role in Classification of Solid Drugs. J. Chem. Inf. Comput. Sci.; (Article); 2003; 43(4); 1177-1398
Reason: 1,2-propanediol base has a melting point around 50 degrees Celsius. The methoxy group introduces additional hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +5 degrees Celsius. The carbonyl group raises the melting point due to the potential for hydrogen bonding and dipole-dipole interactions, estimated at around +10 degrees Celsius. The presence of two additional phenyl groups increases the melting point due to the ability to enhance π-π interactions and overall molecular rigidity. Each phenyl group may contribute around +30 to +50°C.
